Constructor Detail

Cvc3Wrapper

public Cvc3Wrapper()
Method Detail

startSolver

public void startSolver()
                 throws Cvc3WrapperException
Begins a new instance of CVC3. It is necessary to start a fresh instance both initially and after each call to stopSolver.

Throws:
Cvc3WrapperException - if there is an error starting the solver. This is probably a critical error, and the system may not be able to (re)start properly.

stopSolver

public void stopSolver()
                throws Cvc3WrapperException
Destroys the current instance of CVC3. It is necessary re-start the solver in order to redefine any types, functions, or predicates.

Throws:
Cvc3WrapperException - if there is any error stopping the solver. This is probably a critical error and the system may not be able to re-start properly.

declType

public void declType(java.lang.String s)
              throws Cvc3WrapperException
Declares a new type. This may be either a new uninterpreted type, a new complex type (such as a record type), or an alias of an existing type.

Parameters:
s - the new type declaration. This must be a cvc3-readable command string (ending in a semicolon for the presentation language)
Throws:
Cvc3WrapperException - if there are any errors.

declPred

public void declPred(java.lang.String s)
              throws Cvc3WrapperException
Declares a predicate's type.

Parameters:
s - the predicate(s) declaration. This must be a cvc3-readable command string (ending in a semicolon for the presentation language). For the presentation language it is necessary to indicate the predicate is of type BOOLEAN.
Throws:
Cvc3WrapperException - if there are any errors.

declFun

public void declFun(java.lang.String s)
             throws Cvc3WrapperException
Declares a function's type. Note unbound (non-predicate) constants are considered 0-ary functions.

Parameters:
s - the function(s) declaration. This must be a cvc3-readable command string (ending in a semicolon for the presentation language).
Throws:
Cvc3WrapperException - if there are any errors.

assertFormula

public void assertFormula(java.lang.String s)
                   throws Cvc3WrapperException
Asserts a formula. This adds a formula to the current context in a stack-like manner. It is possible to undo assertions. NOTE: If there are multiple commands in a call to assertFormula, this counts as one undoable instance.

Parameters:
s - the formula to be added. This must be a cvc3-readable command string (beginning with ASSERT and ending in a semicolon for the presentation language).
Throws:
Cvc3WrapperException - if there are any errors. In this case the assertion does not "count" for undos.
See Also:
undoAssertion

queryFormula

public java.lang.String queryFormula(java.lang.String s)
                              throws Cvc3WrapperException
Queries a formula. This attempts to determine if a formula is valid in the current context.

Parameters:
s - the formula to be queried. This must be a cvc3-readable command string (beginning with QUERY and ending in a semicolon for the presentation language).
Returns:
a string with one of the following contents:
  • Don't know: lits
  • Abort
  • Valid
  • Invalid: lits
where lits is a list of space-separated TRUE literals from any asserted formulas. Each literal will be contained in parentheses, and negative literals will be prefixed by a tilde. For example: (a) (~b) In the case of "Don't know", this may be a spurious counterexample.
Throws:
Cvc3WrapperException - if there are any errors. In this case the assertion does not "count" for undos.

undoAssert

public int undoAssert(int n)
Undoes the last n assertions.

Parameters:
n - the number of assertions to undo. If n < = 0, nothing is done. If n > the number of assertions, all assertions will be undone.
Returns:
The current scope of the solver -- the number of assertions still in the current context. This is likely only useful for debugging purposes.
See Also:
assertFormula

setFlags

public void setFlags(java.lang.String s)
              throws Cvc3WrapperException
Sets one or more CVC3 command-line flags. Some flags may only be set before the solver is started. Others may be set at any time. If a flag is attempted to be set at the incorrect time, then nothing will change. See the CVC3 documentation for more information.

Parameters:
s - the flag string. This must use the cvc3 command line parameter conventions.
Throws:
Cvc3WrapperException - if there is an unrecognized flag or error.

contextInconsistent

public boolean contextInconsistent()
                            throws Cvc3WrapperException
Checks the inconsistency of the current context.

Returns:
true if current context is inconsistent.
Throws:
Cvc3WrapperException
